stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on building and testing the new rail-shooter section of Return to Yoshi’s Island, modelling a low-poly bird enemy from Super Mario Land, wiring up projectile logic and death animations, and discussing camera, sound, and performance for the stage. He also reviewed thumbnail concepts and talked emulator/plugin plans.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 is roughly "half-way done"; two more stages remain before all levels are blocked out.
development_findings.quote: After this I have two more stages, but course 14 is already like half way done.

development_findings.summary: The side-scrolling section will be fully 3D rather than a 2D homage so it feels new and allows free movement.
development_findings.quote: Would you want to just play a copy of Mario Land on Mario 64? What's the point in that? It has to be different and I chose to make it different by having it be 3D.

development_findings.summary: A low-poly bird enemy (≈50 triangles) was created; head thickness, outlines, and wing texels were tweaked for readability and retro feel.
development_findings.quote: Oh yeah, that looks a lot better. This outline on the birds makes them so much easier to see.

development_findings.summary: Death animation will use an 8-frame texture flip instead of extra geometry to save memory and ROM space.
development_findings.quote: What if we just have it be an animated texture… we're actually not doing voxel art here.

development_findings.summary: Projectile system implemented: Mario fires ‘big balls’; birds can now be hit; cannonball collision and fade-out effects were added.
development_findings.quote: You can kill the birds now… they now fade into white, perfect, that’s what we want.

development_findings.summary: Sound design: settled on the Bullet Bill firing SFX for the cannon shot after testing multiple samples.
development_findings.quote: Let's try this and then if this doesn't work, we go back to the other sound… Oh that's nice. I like it.

development_findings.summary: Whole stage currently ~19 k triangles; memory is tight, so extra wing models and per-frame microcode swapping are avoided.
development_findings.quote: This already has 19,000 triangles and it's like barely finished… we still need the outside here.

development_findings.summary: Gliden’s point-filter bug causes asymmetrical textures; Kaze hopes RT64 or an updated Gliden fixes this before release.
development_findings.quote: I'm hoping Gliden either gets updated or RT64 comes out before my hack releases.

development_findings.summary: He plans to choose RSP or RDP microcode per level and may remove dynamic lighting in the demo if the X2 lighting bug remains unsolved.
development_findings.quote: Still need to fix that one lighting bug in X2… it's not absolutely required for the demo, I can just remove lighting from the demo still.

development_findings.summary: A new public demo is planned "in the near future" but limited to the first course for simplicity.
development_findings.quote: I'm gonna release a new demo at some point in the near future… but it's just going to be the first course.

context_findings.summary: Kaze felt unusually exhausted; attributed it to parents visiting and difficulty being around people.
context_findings.quote: Because my parents are here right now, I can't be around people for too long, no matter who it is.

context_findings.summary: He is reluctant to spend money on commercial games and afraid of pirating due to potential viruses.
context_findings.quote: I just don't want to pay for Minecraft… I'm a little bit scared to pirate games actually.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: every extra setup step loses players; he wants the final build to be as plug-and-play as possible.
context_findings.quote: Every step along the way… you lose some percentage of your player base and the more unusual your setup is the higher the percentage will be.

context_findings.summary: Expressed acceptance of possible Nintendo takedown but chooses to continue regardless.
context_findings.quote: Of course there is a worry that Nintendo is just going to say now fuck you, your game is over, but you just have to live with that.

context_findings.summary: Humorous stance in ongoing ‘pixel-art vs voxel-art’ debate; claims pixel art "is not real".
context_findings.quote: Pixel art is not real by the way, I almost forgot.

biobak.summary: Appeared briefly in chat; no direct work shown in this stream.

zeina.summary: Mentioned only in passing ("Zeina’s tall & cold"), no active participation today.
zeina.quote: Zeina is tall as a cold. Yeah, she's very very cold

key_stories.title: Fixing the Off-Center Camera
key_stories.summary: While testing the shooter segment Kaze realized Mario wasn’t centered on screen despite assumptions. He investigated and corrected the camera matrix.
key_stories.challenge: Players noted aiming issues; Mario appeared off-centre.
key_stories.process: Checked viewport limits, compared to Star Fox, and inspected code.
key_stories.outcome: Re-aligned camera; shooting now feels fair.
key_stories.key_quote: Wow, what the fuck? How is he not centered?… There we go.

key_stories.title: Bird Enemy Redesign
key_stories.summary: Initial bird model looked skinny and hard to read. Community feedback led Kaze to widen the head, add outlines, and adjust texels.
key_stories.challenge: Model lacked readability and retro charm.
key_stories.process: Reviewed sprite references, scaled head by half-texel increments, added outline.
key_stories.outcome: Final model accepted; enemies now easily visible.
key_stories.key_quote: This thickness from Mario looks a lot better though, I agree.

key_stories.title: Choosing the Cannon Shot Sound
key_stories.summary: Needed a satisfying SFX for Mario’s projectile. Tested multiple N64 sounds (unknown, elevator, boulder) before settling on Bullet Bill cannon.
key_stories.challenge: Find a sound that feels ‘Mario-esque’ and readable.
key_stories.process: Iterated through sound bank, compiled each test.
key_stories.outcome: Bullet Bill firing sound selected and integrated.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh that's nice. I like it.

key_stories.title: Barrier to Entry Debate
key_stories.summary: Discussed importance of ease-of-use for players and modders, noting that each extra configuration step loses audience.
key_stories.challenge: Complex emulator setup (plugins, RAM size, patches) deters players.
key_stories.process: Compared Gliden vs upcoming RT64; considered bundling a pre-configured emulator.
key_stories.outcome: Intention to ship a turnkey package when possible.
key_stories.key_quote: The less people have to set up, the better… something that ROM hackers severely underrate is the barrier to entry.
